group_1.textRight: Princess, our tea is ready!
We don't have any snacks to go with it,@though…

group_1.textLeft: It's all right. There would be an outrage if we@indulged ourselves in these times.

group_1.textRight: Yo, Tsuyu, I'm here!

group_1.textLeft: [chara:104501:effect_emotion_surprise_0][se:7226_shock]*Gasp*
You've come once again… Why don't you@just walk in through the front?

group_1.textRight: 'Cause it leaves me wide open.

group_1.textLeft: We might need to increase our patrols,@or otherwise…
Only the Taito can scale the ramparts@so deftly…
Somehow, the two of them are getting along@way better than I thought.

group_1.textRight: I never imagined she'd be coming to visit@every single day…
It ain't looking good…
The rice wholesaler's got nothing left@but weeds.
I already knew things were bad, but this@is somehow even worse.

group_1.textLeft: Still, we've eliminated this year's taxes@and struck out their debt,
and also removed those who were skimming@resources behind our backs.
We're doing everything we can, so our people@should be better off than most…

group_1.textRight: Sango and the other regions are also doing@miserably. It's horrible to watch.
C'mon, let's hurry up and save everyone!

group_1.textLeft: That's easier said than done...
Wait, you can't be serious, Chizuru…
Are you implying we should steal wealth@from the castles and give it all away…?

group_1.textRight: Hey, you get me! That's what happens when@you spend enough time living together.

group_1.textLeft: I don't know about that, though…@I don't think it'll work…
It’s insane. If we do that, I think it'll only lead@to chaos and destruction…

group_1.textRight: Huh, you think so…?

group_1.textLeft: Valor and martial might can only accomplish@so much.
For the time being, we'll have to see what@we can accomplish with wisdom instead.
Since the assault on Taito failed, in order@to prevent an uprising among the people,
we must ask Lord Sumiya to act on the debt moratorium…

group_1.textRight: But you already tried that and it didn't@work, right?

group_1.textLeft: Indeed, but Gen'un has told me he sent@another letter explaining our plight.
Acting Governor Kumai is also going to meet@Lord Sumiya in person.
It'll all come down to that, I think.

group_1.textRight: Hmm…
I don't like being stingy, but if you want us@to wait, then we'll wait.
But after they talk to him, will he approve it@this time…?

group_1.textLeft: Hmm… I think there's a better chance@than there was before.
Since the Sumiya were the ones leading the@attack, their reputation's gone down the tubes.

group_1.textRight: Had it not been for Governor Kumai, our forces@would have been utterly obliterated.
It also seems that the monks of Suitoku have@been in contact with the lords of the land.
Sumiya won't be able to ignore their voices@if they get loud enough.
That reminds me, I heard that the Kumai have@pledged to protect the clans from the Taito.
Apparently, people from all over are being@sheltered and hidden away in Mizuna Castle.

group_1.textLeft: Are they really?

group_1.textRight: Outsiders and Battle Shamanesses@weren't included.

group_1.textLeft: Still, it makes me uneasy that they're returning@to the castle while we're stuck out here…

group_1.textRight: At least it doesn't deviate from Iroha's history,@but still…
Yo, Tsuyu, read this to me.

group_1.textLeft: What? Another one?

group_1.textRight: Hey, even someone like me might see@a Kōwakamai dance someday,
so I gotta know how the original story goes.

group_1.textLeft: Right, it's sometimes performed at shrines,@so you may very well have a chance to see it.
But what would be a good read…?
Atsumori, maybe?

group_1.textRight: I already know it, and Kiso's Petition and the@one about Nasu no Yoichi, too.

group_1.textLeft: …Then perhaps The Great Woven Cap.

group_1.textRight: I dunno, that sounds tough…

group_1.textLeft: It's a tale about recovering a precious crystal@from the clutches of asuras and the Dragon King.

group_1.textRight: That's intense…
